shortlist.name: Ammes (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Comes off a win, indicating peak form. Has the most reliable recent performance in the field and is well-supported in the market. Jockey Sean Bowen is a proven operator, and the trainer is in good form. No signs of regression and connections are solid.

shortlist.name: Treasure Planet (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Represents top connections with Paul Nicholls and Harry Cobden, both highly respected at Chepstow. Market support is notable for a debutant, suggesting strong stable confidence and potential ability. While unraced, the odds and connections justify inclusion.

shortlist.name: Ben Solo (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/5 SBK, 3.1 exchange (clear favourite, solid market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this level with multiple recent runner-up finishes, indicating reliability and competitiveness. Returns after a break but has previously run well fresh. Leading connections and strong market position reinforce claims.

shortlist.name: Tintintin (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Represents a top stable and has shown ability in similar company. While form is a little patchy, he has placed at this level and market confidence is notable. Jockey booking is a positive.

shortlist.name: Ask Brewster (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with two wins from last three starts, suggesting improvement and peak fitness. Trainer/jockey combination is reliable, and odds indicate market respect. No major negatives in recent form.

shortlist.name: Ile De Jersey (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent and in-form, winning two of last four and placed in all recent runs. Top connections with Henderson/de Boinville. Recent win shows readiness and ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Neon Moon (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this grade, regularly in the frame. Pipe stable in good form and runner is proven at the trip. Odds reflect strong market support.

shortlist.name: Destroytheevidence
shortlist.odds_note: 16/5 SBK, 7.0 exchange (market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Placed in three of last four starts at similar level, suggesting reliability. Connections are respected and odds indicate strong market confidence.

shortlist.name: French Ship
shortlist.odds_note: 11/4 SBK, 4.7 exchange (clear favourite, solid market support)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with multiple wins last season, including a strong finish to the campaign. Returns for top connections who excel with fresh horses at this meeting. Consistent form figures and current odds reflect strong market confidence. No signs of decline in recent runs.

shortlist.name: Royal Infantry (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced, proven at this level, and trained by a yard renowned for targeting early-season Chepstow prizes. Consistent last season, with form in competitive company. Jockey/trainer combination is among the most reliable in the UK. Market position suggests strong chance.

shortlist.name: Gibbs Island
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile last season with back-to-back wins before a pulled-up and a below-par effort; returns fresh for a yard adept at readying one after a break. Market support is strong and connections are reliable at this venue.

shortlist.name: Hope Rising (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Ultra-consistent with multiple wins and runner-up finishes in recent starts, showing adaptability and resilience. Remains on an upward curve and is proven at this level; strong connections and reliable recent form.

shortlist.name: Aviemore
shortlist.rationale: Progressed well last campaign with two wins before a pulled-up effort, which can be forgiven given prior consistency. Yard is in good form and the horse has shown ability to win fresh.

shortlist.name: Lightning Flash (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Solid value at 4/1 (exchange 4.4), not an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: Returned from a break to win latest start, suggesting improvement and readiness. Reliable connections and a jockey in form. Recent win indicates peak condition and ability to handle current class.

shortlist.name: No But I Will
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a win last time and multiple placings. Proven ability to compete at this level and holds solid market position. No sign of regression in profile.

shortlist.name: Theatre Of Flight
shortlist.odds_note: 9/4 SBK, 5.0 exchange (clear favourite, solid market support)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form, having won last time out after a progressive profile. Reliable connections and strong market position indicate confidence. No signs of regression in recent runs, and the form figures suggest the horse is still improving or at least holding form at a high level.

shortlist.name: Paddy De Pole (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 6.2 exchange (well-backed, second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with a recent win, trained by a top yard. The form shows regular placings and a bounce-back to winning ways last time, indicating the horse is in good heart. Connections are notable, and odds reflect genuine respect from the market.

shortlist.name: Marlacoo (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 6/1 SBK, 6.4 exchange (third in market, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Very consistent profile with multiple wins and placings in recent starts. Returned with a respectable third, suggesting fitness and form remain intact. Trainer and jockey are both capable, and the horse's profile fits a reliable, in-form contender.

shortlist.name: Platenium (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite at 5/4 (exchange 2.5), clear market leader.
shortlist.rationale: Returned to form with a decisive win last time, suggesting peak fitness and improvement. Connections are in good form and the market support is significant. No major negatives in recent profile.

shortlist.name: Imperfectlyperfect (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a win and a place in last two starts, representing top connections. Recent form suggests readiness and ability at this level. Odds reflect strong market confidence and value for a likely winner.

shortlist.name: Tamarind Bay (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placer with solid recent form, regularly finishing in the frame. Connections are capable and odds indicate genuine market respect. Should be competitive if repeating best efforts.

shortlist.name: Pismo Beach (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placed efforts and a solid fourth last time out. Connections are reliable, and the horse is strongly supported in the market, indicating high confidence from both bookmakers and exchange backers. No major improvement needed; should be at peak fitness for this contest.

shortlist.name: King Roly
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with two wins and a second from last three starts, including a recent victory. Odds reflect strong market confidence and current form cycle is upward. No signs of decline and connections are in good order.

shortlist.name: Florida Dreams (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this level, regularly placing and running well in competitive fields. Top jockey and trainer combination. Market support is solid and form is reliable, suggesting a strong chance if main rival underperforms.

shortlist.name: Roger Pol (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 13/8 SBK, 2.76 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Comes here in peak form, winning last time out and consistently running well this season. Has proven ability at this level and is trained by Jamie Snowden, who places his runners well. The odds reflect strong confidence and the horse does not require major improvement to win again.

shortlist.name: Idem (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/5 SBK, 3.3 exchange (solid second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Represents top connections and has shown ability in similar company. While not as consistent as the favourite, the horse has winning form and is respected in the market. Recent form suggests fitness and ability to contend without needing significant improvement.

shortlist.name: Ballydangan (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/4 SBK, 4.8 exchange (clear market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with two wins from last three starts, including a recent victory. Consistent profile, proven stamina, and holding form well. Market support confirms strong chance.

shortlist.name: Easy Bucks
shortlist.rationale: Recent win on seasonal return shows fitness and ability. Unseated last time but otherwise progressive. Trainer has a good record with similar types.

shortlist.name: Fox's Fancy (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced and consistent, placed in all recent starts. Returns from a break but represents top connections and has scope for improvement.

shortlist.name: Sean Og (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/2 SBK, 6 exchange (short enough, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placer with recent seconds and thirds at this level. Top jockey booked. Reliable profile, though may find one too good for win purposes.

shortlist.name: Freddie Steady Go
shortlist.rationale: Won on debut and placed on reappearance, showing proven ability and consistency. Current odds reflect strong market confidence. No evidence of needing major improvement and has the best recent form in the field.

shortlist.name: March On Oxo (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Represents top connections with a strong record at this track. Market support is notable despite lack of public form, suggesting positive reports or strong homework. Not an outsider by odds and from a yard in form.

shortlist.name: Damysus
shortlist.odds_note: 6/4 SBK, 2.88 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Proven winning form, returns to winning ways last time out, top connections, and current odds reflect strong confidence. No signs of decline and profile fits a peak performer at this level.

shortlist.name: Gladius (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 10/3 SBK, 4.8 exchange (solid second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent, progressive profile with multiple wins and a recent fourth in a likely stronger contest. Top jockey/trainer combo and odds indicate respect from the market.

shortlist.name: First Conquest
shortlist.odds_note: 15/4 SBK, 5.3 exchange (well found in market, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Solid form this season with two wins and recent placed efforts. Trained by a leading yard and partnered by a top jockey. Consistent at this level and odds suggest competitiveness.

shortlist.name: Endorsement (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/4 SBK, 3.6 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a win and a second from two starts, representing the top-class O'Brien yard. Market leader with solid form and proven connections. No sign of regression and expected to be at peak fitness.

shortlist.name: Look To The Stars (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Comes in off back-to-back wins and has never finished outside the top two in four starts. Trained by Appleby and ridden by Buick, both highly reliable at this venue. Consistent, progressive, and well found in the market.

shortlist.name: Pierre Bonnard (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 15/4 SBK, 5.5 exchange (third choice, respected in market)
shortlist.rationale: Improved markedly to win last time out for the O'Brien team. Still unexposed and open to further progress. Soumillon is a top international jockey, and the market respects his chances.

shortlist.name: Hankelow (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Solid recent form with a win and a second, indicating consistency and progression. Trainer is in good form and the odds suggest strong market confidence. No signs of regression and connections are reliable.

shortlist.name: Al Zanati
shortlist.rationale: Impressive debut winner for a top yard. Buick and Appleby are a proven combination at Newmarket, and the odds reflect strong support. Form is unexposed but highly promising.

shortlist.name: Straight Up (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Won on debut for elite connections. Soumillon is a top international jockey and O'Brien excels with juveniles at this meeting. Market respects the horse and form is progressive.

shortlist.name: Distant Storm
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with two wins from last three starts, representing top connections (Appleby/Buick) who excel at this venue. Recent win suggests peak form and odds reflect strong market confidence.

shortlist.name: Gstaad
shortlist.rationale: Ultra-consistent with two wins and two seconds in last four, trained by O'Brien and ridden by Soumillon. Proven at this level and holding form, with odds indicating strong support.

shortlist.name: Zavateri (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Unbeaten in four starts, showing progressive form. Steps up in class but market respect and perfect record warrant inclusion among strongest contenders.

shortlist.name: Reverend Hubert (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 5/1 SBK, 6.2 exchange (solid market support, clear favourite)
shortlist.rationale: Returned to winning form last time out, indicating peak or improving condition. Top jockey booking and respected Irish trainer. Recent win suggests fitness and suitability for the trip/class. Odds reflect strong market confidence and value for a horse with proven recent form and connections.

shortlist.name: Bunting (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced profile with top connections—Mullins/Buick combination is notable. Recent runs in higher grade and lightly campaigned, suggesting scope for improvement. Market respect at single-figure odds despite lack of recent win, indicating potential class edge and readiness.

shortlist.name: Blue To Blue (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with four wins from last five starts, showing consistency and proven ability to win in this grade. Connections are in good order and odds reflect strong market support without being overbet.

shortlist.name: Wedonttelllies (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/4 SBK, 4.2 exchange (market leader, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a win last time out and a lightly raced profile suggesting further improvement is likely. Trainer is adept at placing horses in winnable spots and the market rates this runner highly.

shortlist.name: Celandine
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with recent improvement, strong odds value.

shortlist.name: Dubai Treasure (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Strong connections and recent form suggest potential for a win.

shortlist.name: Circe (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows consistency, though recent performance was less impressive.

shortlist.name: Typeface
shortlist.rationale: Typeface arrives in strong current form, with two recent wins and a close second last time, indicating consistency and peak condition. The Ian Williams stable is respected, and the odds reflect both form and market confidence. No signs of regression in recent runs.

shortlist.name: Oh So Perfect (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced with scope for improvement; last run was a solid effort in a stronger race. Trainer Charlie Fellowes is in good form and the market support is notable. No need for major improvement to win at this level.

shortlist.name: Shetakesthegold
shortlist.rationale: Very consistent profile with multiple recent placings and a win in the last eight starts. Proven at the track and trip, and represents a top yard. Reliable form and no sign of regression.

shortlist.name: Sharpness
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a strong third and fourth in recent starts, suggesting readiness to win soon. Trainer is adept with this type and the odds offer value relative to form. No major improvement required.

shortlist.name: Woody Y Fernandez
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 5.0 exchange (solid market position, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with three consecutive placings, indicating reliability and fitness. Connections are competent at this level. Odds reflect strong market support and realistic winning chance.

shortlist.name: Miss Ayala (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner (last time out), showing clear improvement and ability to win in this grade. Market support is positive and form is peaking at the right time.

shortlist.name: Thanh Nam
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a close fourth last time, suggesting readiness to peak. Market confidence is notable and connections are respected at this level.

shortlist.name: Cryingintherain
shortlist.rationale: Strong market support as clear favourite, representing a trainer in good form. While lacking public form figures, the strength in the betting suggests positive reports from the yard or strong homework. Connections are respected and the booking of Jason Watson is a plus.

shortlist.name: Nala's Dream (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two third-place finishes, indicating reliability and fitness. Trained by Richard Fahey, a proven operator at this level, and the horse is holding its form. Market position confirms expectations of a strong run.

shortlist.name: Hvar
shortlist.odds_note: 5/2 SBK, 3.95 exchange (third choice, not far off market leaders)
shortlist.rationale: Represents a top yard (Ralph Beckett) and has shown ability with a recent fifth and fourth, suggesting improvement is possible. Still lightly raced and open to progress, and the market keeps him onside as a realistic contender.

shortlist.name: Good Earth (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 3/1 SBK, 4.1 exchange (current favourite, solid market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this level with recent runner-up finish indicating current form. Has competitive all-weather record and is well drawn. Connections are reliable at this grade. Odds reflect strong market confidence.

shortlist.name: Fletchers Dream
shortlist.rationale: Latest win shows ability to strike in similar company. Form is a bit patchy but recent victory suggests peak fitness. Market position is positive and profile fits for repeat success at this level.

shortlist.name: Ever Driven (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 3/1 SBK, 5.4 exchange (solid market support, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Returned to winning form last time out, indicating a positive form cycle and possible improvement. Connections are respected at this level, and the odds reflect strong market confidence. Recent win suggests fitness and suitability for current conditions.

shortlist.name: Rockstar Icon (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/2 SBK, 4.9 exchange (well found in the market, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this grade with several respectable efforts in recent starts. Market position indicates stable confidence. Connections are capable, and the horse is fit and holding form, making him a reliable contender.

shortlist.name: Schemaya (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings and a win in last eight starts. Trained by Richard Hannon, who is reliable at this level. Odds indicate strong market confidence and value for a runner with proven ability at the track.

shortlist.name: Curran (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Very consistent profile, regularly finishing in the frame. Charlie Johnston is a trainer in good form and the horse is well-backed, suggesting stable confidence. Recent runs show reliability and competitiveness at this grade.

shortlist.name: Outer Edge
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange 4.1, SBK 13/2; solid market support, clear favourite.
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner this season and holding form well; latest efforts competitive in similar company. Market support is strong and connections are reliable at this level. No major negatives in profile.

shortlist.name: Henery Hawk
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with two wins in last six starts, including recent success. Form is solid for this grade and odds reflect genuine chance. Connections have placed the horse well.

shortlist.name: Basholo (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange 5.2, SBK 10/3; well found in market.
shortlist.rationale: Has placed twice this season and generally runs well at this level. Odds are short, indicating stable confidence. Recent form is competitive and no major improvement is required to feature.

shortlist.name: River Wharfe
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is highly consistent with two wins and multiple placings, indicating reliability and peak condition. Connections are experienced at this level, and odds reflect strong market confidence. No signs of decline in recent runs.

shortlist.name: Enzos Angel
shortlist.rationale: Scored a win three starts back and remains competitive in this grade. Jockey and trainer are both proven, and odds suggest genuine market respect. Recent form is mixed but includes a win and a close second, indicating capability.

shortlist.name: Wyvern
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placer with several top-four finishes recently. Odds are notably short on the exchange, suggesting strong support. Connections are capable, and the horse is reliable at this level, though not as prolific as River Wharfe.

shortlist.name: Division
shortlist.odds_note: 15/8 SBK, 3.5 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with two wins and a second from last three starts, representing a top yard in excellent form. Tom Marquand is a reliable jockey booking. Recent form is the strongest in the field and odds reflect justified confidence.

shortlist.name: Flying Comet
shortlist.odds_note: 10/3 SBK, 4.9 exchange (solid second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with multiple placings and a win in recent starts. Connections are respected and the horse has shown ability to compete at this level. Odds indicate strong market respect and form is reliable.

shortlist.name: Erzindjan (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/4 SBK, 3.9 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form in competitive handicaps, running respectably in higher grades. Drops in class here and retains a top jockey booking. Market support is strong, indicating confidence from connections and punters. No need for major improvement to win at this level.

shortlist.name: Insanity
shortlist.odds_note: 7/1 SBK, 8.8 exchange (solid second tier in market)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form figures show a return to consistency, with two placed efforts in last three starts. Proven at the trip and handles the track. Trainer and jockey are reliable in northern handicaps. Odds offer value for a horse with proven ability at this level.

shortlist.name: He's Waliim
shortlist.rationale: Proven winning form, recent runner-up and win indicate peak condition. Top connections with Tudhope and Tate. Odds reflect strong market support and form reliability.

shortlist.name: Laazm (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with win and second in only two starts, suggesting untapped potential. Balding/McDonald combination is respected. Odds offer reasonable value for a lightly raced improver.

shortlist.name: Boiling Over (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a win two starts back and placed efforts. Trainer Burke is in form and runner is well supported in the market. Reliable for exotics and place prospects.

shortlist.name: Northern Ticker (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 15/4 SBK, 5.3 exchange (clear market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with three wins and two placings in last eight starts, including a win and a solid run in recent outings. Trained by Michael Dods, who is reliable at York, and partnered with an experienced jockey. Current odds indicate strong market support and realistic winning chance.

shortlist.name: Hammer The Hammer (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Excellent recent form with four wins and two seconds in last seven starts, showing both consistency and ability to win in competitive fields. Trainer Kevin Ryan is adept with sprinters at York. Odds reflect genuine market respect.

shortlist.name: Joulany (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Runner-up on debut, representing a top yard with a strong record in similar races. The market leader, suggesting confidence from connections and punters. No need for major improvement to win here.

shortlist.name: Morshdi
shortlist.rationale: Solid debut second for a leading trainer/jockey combination. Well-supported in the market and likely to progress, with proven ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Valenday
shortlist.rationale: Another debut runner-up, showing immediate promise. Trainer has a good record with juveniles at York. Market support suggests a competitive chance.

shortlist.name: Molten Sea
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with a recent win and multiple placings this season. Trained by William Haggas, a top yard, and partnered with Tom Marquand, both strong connections. Current odds offer value for a horse with proven form at this level and no major negatives in the profile.

shortlist.name: Berkshire Sundance (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile last season with two wins before a break; returns for a top yard with a capable jockey. Market support is notable, and the form suggests ability to win at this level if fit. No evidence of needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: Queen Roslyn
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with back-to-back wins before latest run. Trainer is adept at placing horses at York, and the recent form is strong for this grade. Odds reflect genuine chance without being overbet.

shortlist.name: Spioradalta
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with four consecutive wins, indicating a horse at the top of its cycle. Consistency and proven ability to win in current conditions make this runner a standout. Odds reflect strong market confidence without being overbet, suggesting value remains. Connections are reliable and the form is progressive, not showing signs of tail-off.

shortlist.name: I Still Have Faith
shortlist.odds_note: 5/1 SBK, 9.6 exchange (solid market position, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Ultra-consistent recent form with three consecutive runner-up finishes, indicating a horse knocking on the door. Has been holding form well and is likely to be suited by the race conditions. Odds are competitive, and the horse does not require major improvement to win—just a repeat of recent efforts.

shortlist.name: Relieved Of Duties (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this level with a top jockey and trainer combination. Recent form includes a fall and a fifth, but prior runs show reliability and ability to compete in this grade. Market support is strong, indicating stable confidence.

shortlist.name: Come On The Lads (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Very consistent recent form, regularly placing and winning at this level. Trainer and jockey are both in good form. Odds reflect realistic winning chance without being overbet.

shortlist.name: Koori Star (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is solid, with multiple placings and a close fourth last time out. Connections are capable, and exchange market support is notable. Should be competitive if repeating recent efforts.

shortlist.name: Kamikaz Du Plessis (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two wins and three placings from last five starts, representing top connections (Elliott/Kennedy). Current odds reflect strong market confidence and suggest little improvement is needed to win again.

shortlist.name: Barry Lyndon (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner before a pulled-up effort, but overall profile is competitive at this level. Market support is strong, and connections are respected locally. If bouncing back to best, rates a major threat.

shortlist.name: Paul's Dream (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/2 SBK, 5.0 exchange (solid market support, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two runner-up finishes and two wins in last six starts, indicating peak fitness and reliability. Connections are respected and the horse is holding form well, with no signs of decline. Odds reflect strong market confidence.

shortlist.name: Desert Haven
shortlist.odds_note: 15/2 SBK, 3.4 exchange (not a longshot, exchange market favourite)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form figures show three placings from last four starts, including a close second and third, suggesting the horse is in good shape and ready to win. The exchange market has made this runner favourite, indicating strong professional support.

shortlist.name: Tequila Talkin' (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and third in last three completed starts, with a fall and a pulled-up run that can be forgiven in context of jumps racing. Trainer is capable and the market support is notable. Horse has shown ability to win at this level.

shortlist.name: Midnight Moonshine (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a win and runner-up finish in last three starts. Proven ability at this level and distance. Connections are in good order and the horse is holding form, not needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: Western Model (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Placed in two of last three runs, showing reliability and competitiveness. Trainer and jockey are respected, and the horse is running to a consistent level. No signs of decline in form.

shortlist.name: Another Choice (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Runner-up last time out, indicating improvement and readiness. Odds suggest market confidence. Connections capable and horse does not require major improvement to win.

shortlist.name: High Notions (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent placing, best odds profile, and no signs of decline. Connections are solid and the horse is likely at peak fitness based on last run. No major improvement needed; expected to run to form.

shortlist.name: Noble Name (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and placed efforts indicate reliability and ability at this level. Form is progressive, and odds offer value for a runner with proven ability. Connections are competent and the horse is fit.

shortlist.name: Apples Jane (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form in competitive races, trained by a top yard. Recent second suggests readiness and ability to contend. Odds are fair for a runner with strong connections and no major improvement required.

shortlist.name: Cowper Hall (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Strong market support as clear favourite; recent form figures show two third-place finishes before a break, suggesting consistency at this level. Trained by Gavin Cromwell, a respected yard, and returns in a winnable race. No need for major improvement to win here.

shortlist.name: Farrokh (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings, including two seconds and two thirds in last five starts. Proven reliability at this grade and trip. Connections are in good order and the horse is fit and holding form.

shortlist.name: Minella Jury (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Comes off a solid third last time, showing reliable recent form. Connections are respected in Irish point-to-point and amateur races. Current odds indicate strong market confidence and suggest the horse is expected to run to form. No signs of needing major improvement, and profile fits typical winner criteria for this type of contest.

shortlist.name: Ballymoreen (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent fourth suggests competitive ability at this level. Odds are short enough to indicate market respect, and the horse does not require significant improvement to contend. Connections have placed horses in similar contests, and the form is consistent with a typical winner profile for this grade.

shortlist.name: Cape Cod (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with improving form figures (third, then second last time), trained by Aidan O'Brien, and currently clear favourite in the market. Connections are top class and the horse is expected to be at peak fitness for this assignment.

shortlist.name: Enceladus (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Debuted with a promising third, representing a leading yard. Open to significant improvement on second start and market support is solid, indicating strong expectations from connections.

shortlist.name: Diego El Queso (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two runner-up finishes, indicating readiness to win. Top jockey and trainer combination. Short odds reflect strong market confidence and form reliability.

shortlist.name: Maestro Bernstein (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Represents a leading stable with a strong record in maidens. Only one run (8th) but likely to improve significantly on debut, as is typical for the yard. Market support suggests ability.

shortlist.name: Retrograde (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: From a top yard and shaped with promise on debut (5th). Expected to progress with experience. Market position indicates respect and potential for improvement.

shortlist.name: Amiata (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange 3.9, SBK 7/1 (solid market support, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win signals peak form and readiness. Connections are strong: Lyons/Keane are proven at Naas. Odds indicate genuine market respect, and the horse is not overexposed.

shortlist.name: First Approach (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Aidan O'Brien-trained runner with competitive form in higher grade races. Recent placings suggest consistency and class edge. Odds are fair for a horse with top connections and proven ability.

shortlist.name: Morehampton (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with a win and placed efforts in recent starts. Murtagh/Coen combination is reliable, and the horse is well-fancied in the market, suggesting confidence from connections and punters.

shortlist.name: Nakamura (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in top form with back-to-back wins, indicating improvement and peak fitness. Trainer is in form, and odds reflect strong market confidence. No signs of needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: Powerful Nation (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this level with a win and two places in last six starts; recent form slightly dipped but remains competitive. Connections are reliable and odds indicate strong market confidence.

shortlist.name: Queen Of Mougins (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner this season and generally consistent in the frame. Slight dip last time but overall profile is progressive for this grade. Jockey/trainer combination is respected.

shortlist.name: Fandom
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced, progressive profile with two wins from last four starts. Fifth on seasonal return can be forgiven; likely to improve for top connections. Market support is notable.

shortlist.name: Thunderbear (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 6/1 SBK, 3.65 exchange (market support, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placer at this level, often in the mix. Recent form solid and exchange odds suggest genuine support. Connections capable of landing a competitive handicap.

shortlist.name: Nezeeh (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/2 (sbk), 3.7 (exchange) – solid market support, not an outsider
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple wins and placings, including a win two starts ago. Proven fitness and reliability, with connections in good order. Odds indicate strong market confidence and value for a runner with this profile.
shortlist.confidence: High – best recent form in the field, strong win record, and market support.

shortlist.name: Arklow Lad (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Rapid recent improvement, culminating in a win last time out. Lightly raced and open to further progress. Top jockey booked and market position suggests stable confidence.
shortlist.confidence: High – progressive profile, recent win, and strong connections.

shortlist.name: Escaping Thejungle (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent runner-up effort signals return to form after a win three starts back. Versatile and fit, with odds suggesting market respect. Connections capable at this level.
shortlist.confidence: Medium-High – recent form is solid, market support is notable.

shortlist.name: Likedbymike (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent at this level, with a strong second last time out. Top jockey booking is a positive. Odds indicate market confidence for a horse with proven ability in similar races.
shortlist.confidence: Medium – reliable profile, strong connections, and competitive odds.

shortlist.name: Treasure Rose (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong market support (exchange 2.46, sbk 3/1); clear favourite.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings, suggesting reliability and fitness. Connections are respected, and odds indicate strong market confidence. No sign of regression in form cycle, and profile fits a likely winner at this level.

shortlist.name: Therewillbeglory (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Well-backed (exchange 3.5, sbk 2/1); second choice in market.
shortlist.rationale: Ultra-consistent with three consecutive runner-up finishes, indicating readiness to win. Form is peaking and horse is holding condition well. Market position and recent efforts suggest a breakthrough is imminent.

shortlist.name: Tea Rose (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Solid support (exchange 3.6, sbk 5/1); third in market.
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile for top connections. Two fourths this season after a break suggest improvement is likely, and O'Brien-trained runners often peak with racing. Market respect and potential for further progress make this a strong contender.

shortlist.name: Rowdy Yeats (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with multiple recent wins and places, including a last-time-out victory. Top jockey booking and trainer in form. Profile suggests reliability and peak fitness, with odds reflecting strong market confidence.

shortlist.name: Bishopton (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in top form after back-to-back wins, indicating improvement and readiness. Connections have placed the horse well and the odds suggest genuine market respect. Recent form is peaking at the right time.

shortlist.name: Tina's Indian (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent third signals return to form after a win last season. Consistent at this level and market support is notable. Jockey/trainer combination is reliable and the horse is fit and competitive.

shortlist.name: Samangan (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in early exchange and bookmaker markets; not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Represents a top French stable with a leading jockey booking. Graffard and Barzalona are a proven combination at Chantilly, and market support is strong. Connections suggest readiness and intent, making this runner a standout on paper.

shortlist.name: Street Show (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Well found in the market; not an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: Guyon is a leading rider at Chantilly and the Brandt stable is in good form. Market position indicates confidence, and the local connections are reliable in these conditions.

shortlist.name: Tadej
shortlist.odds_note: Short in the market, suggesting strong support.
shortlist.rationale: International raider with a top UK jockey and trainer combination. Doyle and Watson are highly effective with juveniles and when targeting French races, and the market respect is notable.

shortlist.name: Nitoi (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Likely to be among the market leaders based on top connections and typical betting patterns for Fabre/Guyon at Chantilly.
shortlist.rationale: Andre Fabre is the leading trainer in France and Maxime Guyon is a top jockey; this combination is highly respected and often attracts strong market support. Even without published form, the connections alone make this runner a standout in a field lacking exposed form.

shortlist.name: Midak (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Expected to be prominent in the betting given Graffard/Barzalona's strong strike rate at this venue.
shortlist.rationale: Francis-Henri Graffard is a proven trainer at Chantilly and Mickael Barzalona is a leading jockey. Horses from this yard are typically well-prepared for debut or early runs, and market confidence is usually justified.

shortlist.name: Amilcare (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Should be single-figure odds based on Demuro's booking and Baratti's reputation with juveniles.
shortlist.rationale: Cristian Demuro is a top jockey in France and M. Baratti is an emerging trainer with a good record in these races. The combination suggests the horse is expected to be competitive, especially in a field with little exposed form.

shortlist.name: Kenzel (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in early market, not a longshot; Guyon/Ferland a proven high-class pairing in French racing.
shortlist.rationale: Kenzel is partnered by Maxime Guyon, one of France's top jockeys, and trained by Christophe Ferland, a trainer with a strong record at Chantilly. The connections alone suggest intent and ability at this level. Early market support (not a longshot) further underlines confidence from informed punters.

shortlist.name: Ulymine (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Well found in the market; Lerner team consistently competitive in similar races.
shortlist.rationale: Ulymine represents the Lerner stable, which is highly respected for placing horses to advantage at Chantilly. Alexis Pouchin is a capable jockey, and the lack of outsider odds suggests the horse is expected to be competitive.

shortlist.name: Piana (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Not a longshot; Pasquier is a top jockey with a strong record at this venue.
shortlist.rationale: Piana is ridden by Stephane Pasquier, a jockey with a proven record at Chantilly and in French pattern races. The Caullery stable is adept at readying horses for these events, and market position confirms expectations of a strong run.

shortlist.name: Opulent Restraint (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in early exchange and fixed-odds markets; not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Trained by Chad Brown, a leading turf trainer with a high strike rate at Keeneland, and ridden by Joel Rosario, a top jockey. Connections are consistently successful in this type of race. Market support is strong, indicating stable confidence.

shortlist.name: Destino D'oro (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Well found in the market; not an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: Brad Cox and Irad Ortiz Jr. are a powerful trainer-jockey combination with excellent recent records at Keeneland. Destino D'oro is attracting market support and represents a barn in top form.

shortlist.name: Will Then (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Short in early betting; respected connections.
shortlist.rationale: Frankie Dettori is a world-class jockey and Jonathan Thomas is a capable trainer, especially with lightly raced types. The horse is well regarded in the market and does not require major improvement to contend.

shortlist.name: Fionn (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Among market leaders; not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Another Brad Cox runner with Flavien Prat, who excels at Keeneland. Market signals are positive and the connections are highly reliable at this level.

shortlist.name: Golden Canary (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Consistently trades as a leading market contender in Woodbine stakes; not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Trained by Mark Casse, a top Woodbine trainer with a strong record in juvenile and stakes company. Golden Canary has previously shown class and speed at this level, and Casse's runners are typically well-prepared for these events. Market support is usually strong for this barn, indicating confidence.

shortlist.name: Biles (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Expected to be among the market leaders given connections and recent profile.
shortlist.rationale: Represents Josie Carroll, a leading Canadian trainer, and is partnered by Patrick Husbands, one of the top jockeys at Woodbine. This combination is highly effective, and Biles has shown ability in similar company. The horse is unlikely to be a longshot and has the right profile for this contest.

shortlist.name: Pop Idol (Can)
shortlist.odds_note: Expected to be among market leaders based on top connections and typical market support for this profile.
shortlist.rationale: Pop Idol (Can) is partnered with John R. Velazquez, a leading jockey, and trained by George Weaver, a respected trainer with a strong record at Aqueduct. This combination is often well-supported in the market and signals intent. The lack of published form is a minor concern but the connections suggest readiness and ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Flat Out Time (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Likely to be prominent in the betting given Castellano and Weaver's record.
shortlist.rationale: Flat Out Time (Usa) is another George Weaver runner, this time with Javier Castellano, another top-tier jockey. Weaver often excels with multiple entries, and Castellano's booking is a positive. Market support is anticipated for this profile, and the connections alone justify strong consideration.

shortlist.name: Abientot (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Should be single-figure odds based on Casse's reputation and Davis's local knowledge.
shortlist.rationale: Abientot (Usa) is trained by Mark E. Casse, a high-percentage trainer in North America, and ridden by Dylan Davis, who is effective at Aqueduct. This pairing is typically competitive in similar maiden or allowance company and should attract market respect.

shortlist.name: Army Gal (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Expected to be well found in the market due to Rice/Lezcano combination.
shortlist.rationale: Army Gal (Usa) is trained by Linda Rice, a prolific trainer at Aqueduct, and ridden by Jose Lezcano, a jockey with a strong local record. This combination is often well supported and rarely overlooked by the market, making Army Gal a logical inclusion.

shortlist.name: Stone Of Scone (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: 1.52 exchange (joint market leader, no clear outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with all runs in the top five, including two top-three finishes. Muzi Yeni is a leading jockey in South Africa, and the horse is trained by a respected local trainer. The profile suggests reliability and readiness, with no signs of regression or need for major improvement. Odds reflect strong market confidence.

shortlist.name: Top Shelf Teddy (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: 1.52 exchange (joint market leader, no clear outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced with progressive form, improving from 7th to 3rd last time out. Craig Zackey is a top jockey, and S. G. Tarry is a leading trainer, indicating strong connections. The horse is unexposed and open to further improvement, which is valuable in a field lacking standout winners. Odds indicate strong market support.

shortlist.name: Winds Of Grace (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: 1.52 exchange (joint market leader, no clear outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Very consistent, with multiple second and third-place finishes in recent starts. The horse is repeatedly knocking on the door for a win, and the Azzie stable is well regarded. While not flashy, the consistency and market support make this runner a solid contender.

shortlist.name: Korcula (Saf)
shortlist.trainer: J. J. van Vuuren, South Africa
shortlist.rationale: Showed immediate improvement from debut to second start, finishing 3rd last time; lightly raced with scope for further progress. Trainer is respected locally and the form profile is upwardly mobile, making this runner a strong contender in a modest field.

shortlist.name: Royale Jacket (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with multiple placings at this level; recent form figures indicate reliability and readiness. Connections are solid and the horse has proven stamina and experience, which is valuable in this company.

shortlist.name: Parabellum (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with several top-five finishes, suggesting a strong contender.

shortlist.name: Green Machine (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent third-place finish indicates potential, especially with a strong trainer like de Kock.

shortlist.name: It's Personal (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two wins and multiple placings in last six starts, indicating peak or near-peak condition. Top jockey Muzi Yeni is a positive booking, and the trainer is in form. No signs of regression in the form cycle, and odds reflect strong confidence from the market.

shortlist.name: Super Awesome (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win last time out and a second prior, showing clear improvement and ability to win at this level. The form cycle suggests the horse is peaking, and the stable is in good order. Odds indicate strong market expectation.

shortlist.name: Hemisphere (Saf)
shortlist.trainer: J. J. van Vuuren, South Africa
shortlist.rationale: Has been highly consistent with two wins and two seconds in last five starts, suggesting reliable current form. Trainer and jockey are both respected, and the horse is holding form well without signs of decline.

shortlist.name: Matcha Mint (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Very short odds (1.24 exchange), clear market leader.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings and a win last time out. Top local jockey booked and strong trainer. No signs of decline and fitness is assured. Market confidence is extremely strong, suggesting little opposition.

shortlist.name: Lava Lamp (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with three consecutive wins, indicating strong current condition and upward trajectory. No signs of regression and connections are in form. Consistency and proven winning ability make this runner a standout.

shortlist.name: Teo Torriatte (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Has won three of last five starts and placed second last time, showing sustained high-level performance. Reliable profile with proven ability to win in this grade. Connections are respected and the horse is holding form.

shortlist.name: United Council (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with multiple wins and placings this season. Recent third and first suggest the horse is maintaining form and competitive at this level. Jockey/trainer combination is strong for this circuit.

shortlist.name: Chronicle King (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange odds 1.22, indicating strong market support.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple wins and placings, suggesting reliability and peak condition. Jockey Muzi Yeni is a proven performer, and trainer C. Dawson has a strong record at Turffontein. The odds reflect high confidence from the market.

shortlist.name: Echo Check (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Unbeaten in two starts, showing clear upward trajectory and adaptability. Jockey Rachel Venniker is in good form, and trainer F. P. Habib is respected locally. The horse’s profile fits the criteria for a progressive winner at this level.

shortlist.name: Copper Eagle (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange odds 1.22, indicating strong market support.
shortlist.rationale: Won on debut and followed up with a solid second, indicating ability and consistency. Jockey Kabelo Matsunyane is reliable, and trainer R. Klaasen has a good strike rate with similar types. The horse’s form and odds suggest genuine winning potential.

shortlist.name: Roaming Spirit (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Current exchange odds 1.52, indicating strong market support.
shortlist.rationale: Comes into the race in peak form with three wins from last four starts, including back-to-back victories. Trained by the de Kock stable, a top South African yard, and partnered by a leading jockey. Consistency and proven winning ability at this level make this runner a standout.

shortlist.name: Pennsylvania (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Current exchange odds 1.52, suggesting strong market confidence.
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is progressive, with a win and a second in last two starts. Consistently competitive in similar company and represents a stable in good form. Reliable profile and strong recent efforts make this runner a key contender.

shortlist.name: Trip To States (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Clear market leader at 1.52, indicating strong support.
shortlist.rationale: Recent win (last time out) and consistent form in the frame prior; top connections and fitness assured. Market confidence aligns with form profile.

shortlist.name: Phala Millions (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Well found in the market at 1.52, suggesting strong chance.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings and a win two starts back; reliable profile for this grade and trip.

shortlist.name: Princess Lola (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Short in the market at 1.52, indicating respect.
shortlist.rationale: Placed in last three starts, showing steady improvement; top jockey booking and proven fitness.
